newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU ruling on P&O, Stena ferry link by mid-June.
newsitem.headline: EU ruling on P&O, Stena ferry link by mid-June.

text.p: The European Commission has until mid June to decide whether to challenge the proposed joint venture between the Peninsular and Oriental Steam Navigation Company (P&O) and Stena Line AB, Commission sources said on Friday.
The companies submitted their agreement for clearance on October 1996 and on March 13 the Commission published a notice in the Official Journal calling on interested parties to make comments.
The sources told Reuters that regulation 4056/86 applying article 85 of the treaty of Rome to the shipping sector gives it 90 days from the date of publication to express any concerns it has.
"If we don't object within 90 days it's deemed exempt (from article 85) for six years," one source said.
The source added that the Commission had not expressed any concerns so far. But even if it did it would not mean that "the deal is dead in the water".

The agreement, to merge the two companies' cross-channel ferry operations, is also being investigated in Britain and France. The Commission is said to be working in close cooperation with the French and British authorities.
P&O said earlier this month it was expecting a decision on the merger before the end of May.
